intro: Octarrhena longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed grass, is a species of flowering plant in the Poaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Sudan and South Sudan. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Octarrhena longicaulis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
